title: BBC Local Live: Cumbria for Friday 20 October 2017 - BBC News
summary: carlisle strike first to fall foul of new rule .
bowness tourist honeypot improvements formally opened .
mp and train campaigners meet operator over cancelled services .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 've now finished posting the news , travel reports and a regular weather forecast for today and this week .
here 's a reminder :
we 'll be back to do it all again from 08:00 on monday .

as always , if you want to pass on news you think we should know , or share a photo with the county , you can email them to us , send them using twitter where we 're @ twitterid or head to our facebook page .
have a good ( if very windy ) weekend .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: cyclist claims confrontation led to 'bruising ' crash
text: a carlisle cyclist is appealing for witnesses after police said they lacked evidence to investigate an incident which left him with this bruise .
steve alecock says a van driver stepped out in front of him after an argument that developed along a narrow and winding section of the a591 between the low wood hotel and ambleside .
mr alecock said police have been unable to trace witnesses who 'd helped him after he went over the handlebars .
police have confirmed he 's reported the incident .
there was no excuse for what happened to me really , because he 'd got past me and if he 'd wanted to he could have just driven off , and he chose not to , he chose confrontation . ''

documents.title: youngsters tour london at night in wordsworth tribute
text: one of the most famous poems by william wordsworth was about the view from westminster bridge , and youngsters from grasmere school have been to see what he was talking about .
for the most spectacular view , they went at night .
our night time london walk is famous .
the best time to see london !
`` earth has not anything to show more fare '' @ twitterid

documents.title: poppies will form carlisle castle show next year
text: part of the famous installation of ceramic poppies , which surrounded the tower of london in 2014 to mark the centenary of the start of world war one , is coming to carlisle
a display called weeping window will be installed at carlisle castle between 23 may and 8 july next year .

documents.title: langdale event remembers when artist was declared 'degenerate '
text: supporters of the merz barn , where the influential german artist kurt schwitters spent his final years in great langdale , will gather tomorrow to mark the 80th anniversary of the nazi exhibition in 1937 when his abstract art was denounced by the dictator adolf hitler .
a work by schwitters , now seen as one of the most influential abstract artists of the last century , was at the entrance of the exhibition of `` degenerates '' banned by the nazi government .

he fled , first to norway and then to britain where , after being detained in the isle of man , he worked in a barn in the middle of woodland , scratching a living by painting portraits of tourists in nearby ambleside .
a trust has spent a number of years restoring and protecting the barn .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : storm warning posted for high winds
text: a band of rain will quickly sweep east across cumbria this evening , with clear spells and a few blustery showers following into early hours .
there 's a yellow warning of high winds , mainly from the south to south east through tomorrow .
you can see the latest bbc weater forecast for where you are , and details of the weather warning , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: egremont addict jailed for robbing lone shop worker
text: a drug addict who forced a woman serving on her own at a corner shop in workington to hand over £ 160 has been jailed for four years .
adam littleton , 23 , of central avenue , egremont , threatened her with a piece of wood studded with nails .
carlisle crown court was told he 'd taken `` a cocktail of substances '' .
littleton admitted robbery , having an offensive weapon , and assaulting police , and judge james adkin also imposed an extended two-year licence period .

documents.title: carlisle 's miller banned for diving
text: carlisle 's miller banned for diving

documents.title: national trust members to debate ban on trail hunting
text: whether trail hunting should be allowed on national trust land will be the centre of debate at the annual general meeting tomorrow .

hunts have sent the hounds to follow a trail of fox urine to continue their sport since hunting foxes with dogs was banned , but opponents have claimed this is used as a cover for continuing to chase and kill them .

five members have put forward a motion at the agm to vote in favour of a ban on trail hunting on trust land , but trustees have asked members to declare this as disproportionate , proposing instead to require hunts to publicise their meetings .
the hunts say a ban would destroy the lake district tradition of following the hounds on foot , while requiring publicity would be an invitation to objectors to demonstrate against them

documents.title: farmer frank 's feeding covers win national plaudit
text: a farmer from ulverston has won a national award for designing a simple cover for cattle feed that saves labour and waste .
frank morphet , who runs a herd of 160 dairy cattle on his organic farm , won the gold award in the british farming awards .
the cover 's slung on the side of a cow shed , and automatically protects feed spread alongside the shed from rain , as well as stopping the cows pushing it out of reach as they try to eat it .

documents.title: whitehaven dancers step out for broadway show
text: a dance group from west cumbria is rehearsing for a show on new york 's broadway this weekend .
girls from the cowper school of dance in whitehaven passed an audition with smile productions .
the company organises regular shows around the uk and overseas , in new york , las vegas and spain , to give dance schools the chance to showcase their talents .
we 're actually going to be starting the show , and finishing the first half with 42nd street . ''

documents.title: miller suspended for two games as fa rejects carlisle appeal
text: the fa has confirmed that shaun miller will be suspended for two games for diving .
miller was the first player to be disciplined under new rules forbidding the `` successful deception of a match official '' , after a penalty in the match against wycombe , which ended in a draw .
the club appealed , but this afternoon the fa rejected their case .
author: BBC Cumbria Sport

documents.title: driver rescued from harbour is arrested
text: a driver 's been arrested after being rescued from a car that plunged into whitehaven harbour yesterday evening .
passers-by helped police rescue the 31-year-old man from the ford kuga , which landed close to the water 's edge .
he was not injured .
he 's being questioned on sus of dangerous driving .
fire crews , coastguards and the workington lifeboat were also called but stood down once the man was safe .

documents.title: 'remarkable ' runner gary given freedom of copeland
text: an athlete from west cumbria is being given the freedom of copeland today after he ran 100 marathons in 100 days to raise money for a cancer charity .
gary mckee , from cleator moor , raised £ 300,000 in his campaign , which ended with the london marathon .
copeland council says it is `` extremely rare '' for anyone to be given the honour , but gary 's efforts had been `` remarkable '' .

documents.title: 'sexual predator ' jailed for abusing girl
text: 'sexual predator ' jailed for abusing girl

documents.title: businesses welcome lakeshore facelift
text: businesses along the glebe in bowness , which offers millions of visitors one of the best views of windermere every year , have welcomed the facelift to the area just completed .
local authorities have spent £ 2m on new paving and benches , such as this area , and reorganising parking along the roadside .
previously muddy banks have been turned into walking areas with landscaped gardens .
david ferguson , who owns the old pump house cafe , says the improvements are `` a super job '' .
it 's made it safer , it 's made it more attractive , i do n't think it 's brought in more tourists but it 's made it a more attractive experience for them . ''

documents.title: barrow boss : stick with us while we hunt for new coach
text: barrow managing director andrew casson has called for the club 's supporters to get behind the team as the search for a new manager continues .
sections of the bluebirds support have been vocal in their criticism of the club 's decision to appoint micky moore , who was sacked from his position this week .
barrow travel to ebbsfleet in the national league tomorrow under caretaker coach neill hornby .
author: BBC Cumbria Sport

documents.title: man jailed for sexually assaulting child
text: a man who sexually assaulted a child in the appleby area has been jailed for four years .
roger david cook , 50 , who is now of no fixed address , admitted three counts of indecent assault between 1999 and 2000 .
in a statement his victim , who is now an adult , said : `` i will carry around with me what he has done to me for ever . ''
cook was also ordered to sign the sex offenders register and made subject to a sexual harm prevention order for five years .

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : brightening up with chance of a shower
text: it 'll brighten up for most today across cumbria , with some sunny spells developing through the afternoon , with a few scattered showers and temperatures around 15c ( 59f ) .
there is a yellow weather warning for tomorrow , when storm brian is expected to bring winds gusting to 60mph or more later in the day .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are , and details of the warning , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: man arrested after call from 'paedophile hunting group '
text: a man from aspatria has been arrested over child sex offences after a call from a `` paedophile hunting group '' , police have said .
officers were contacted at 21:30 last night .
the 47-year-old is being questioned on sus of grooming and inciting a child to engage in sexual activity .

documents.title: environmentalists plan court challenge to mine scheme
text: campaigners are threatening legal action if plans for a new coal mine in whitehaven are approved .
west cumbria mining wants to dig for coal under the sea at the woodhouse colliery , saying it will create more than 500 jobs producing coking coal for the steel industry .
the campaign group keep cumbrian coal in the hole objects to the plan because it believes burning coal could increase climate change .

documents.title: whitehaven wins £ 1.67m grant for bransty improvements
text: a scheme to improve the north shore and bransty areas of whitehaven has won £ 1.67m in government funding .

cumbria county council applied in june for funds from the national productivity investment fund , which will go towards the north shore access project for road works in the north of whitehaven and in the brantsy area .
bigger plans could see whitehaven 's bus station re-developed to include offices , a hotel and a multi-storey carpark .

documents.title: travel : signals hitch slows coast line trains
text: there are delays of up to 40 minutes on trains between whitehaven and barrow after an earlier signalling problem at st bees .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: carlisle to appeal against keeper 's diving charge
text: carlisle united are to fight the diving charge on forward shaun miller , who became the first player to be charged by the fa under new simulation laws since they were introduced in may .
the blues were awarded a penalty in the first half of tuesday 's league two game when miller went down under a challenge by wycombe defender dan scarr in the area .
should the charge , of successfully deceiving a match official , be proved , the striker will face a two-match ban .
carlisle will not comment further until the appeal has been heard .
author: BBC Cumbria Sport

documents.title: train campaigners and mp to lobby over 50-year-old locos
text: the train operator northern will be told it can not keep providing a `` third world service '' to more than one and a half million people who use the furness and cumbrian coast lines , at a meeting today .
the furness line action group will join the labour mp john woodcock in demanding immediate improvements at a meeting today .
it is not fit for purpose , but one has to say it 's not all northern 's fault , it stems back to when the first northern franchise was put into place . ''
the campaigners say diesel trains , some more than 50 years old , break down on average almost every day , and crew shortages mean other services are cancelled .
so far bbc radio cumbria 's been unable to obtain any response from northern .

documents.title: no more toys please , say barrow 's charity shops
text: some charity chops in barrow say they can no longer cope with the number of toys they have been given .
age uk on rawlinson street has stopped taking donations in the run-up to christmas and animal refuge says it gets so many , some are ending up in a tip .
we sell quite a few soft toys , but not for children - people buy them for their dogs . ''

documents.title: weather on the fell tops : middling
text: weather on the fell tops : middling

documents.title: £ 2m facelift complete at lakes beauty sport
text: a £ 2m facelift to the glebe , a lakeshore road at bowness on windermere which is the first port of call for many new visitors to the lake district , has been pronounced complete .
new paving and street furniture such as boardwalks and benches , and a new lay-out for roads , were paid for by south lakeland council and cumbria 's local enterprise partnership .

the glebe , which runs from lake steamer piers to a walk along the lake shore and major car parks , with fine views up england 's longest lakes to the fells , is visited by several million people every year
author: John Bowness
BBC Radio Cumbria reporter

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : bright spells developing
text: outbreaks of rain will clear as we head through the morning , with some bright and sunny spells developing through the morning .
winds will be light , with temperatures around 15c ( 59f ) .
there 's a yellow warning of wind for tomorrow morning , which covers the high spring tides for the cumbrian coast , so there 's a threat of flooding .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are , and details of the weather warning , here .

documents.title: travel : road and bridge closed for storm repairs
text: north shore road in whitehaven and ford bridge in burneside near kendal remain closed for repairs after recent bad weather .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: good morning , and welcome to bbc cumbria live
text: we 'll be posting news , travel reports , a regular weather forecast and other things that may catch our eye from around this county , until about 18:00 .

as always , if you want to pass on news you think we should know , or share a photo with the county , you can email them to us , send them using twitter where we 're @ twitterid or head to our facebook page .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter
